website_summaries.verdict: Powerful and versatile outdoor high-definition security camera with backup battery, two-way talk and siren.
pros: Exceptional outdoor security camera with great smartphone app integration
See and speak to visitors and delivery services
Motion triggers light as a deterrent
cons: Motion activated light tends to stay on for long times

website_summaries.verdict: The Ring Spotlight Cam's easy setup and solid performance make it a favorite among today's outdoor cameras with built-in lights.
pros: Ring's $199 Spotlight Cam (£199/AU$329) installs in minutes and its integrated LEDs provide reliable security lighting for your yard
cons: You have to pay for Ring's Protect cloud storage service to access saved video clips

customer_reviews.title: The camera didn’t work very well at all. When ...
customer_reviews.text: The camera didn’t work very well at all. When I had the motion sensor turned up, it would pick people up in my yard sometimes, however it would also pick up cars driving by on my road. When I turned the motion settings down a little to avoid the road, it wouldn’t detect anyone in my yard. It picked up vehicles alright, but not people very well. I did spend quite a bit of time messing with the settings trying to get it to work with no success. I gave up and sent the Ring camera back to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Wireless Freedom - Ring Cam Battery
customer_reviews.text: Love the freedom of wireless, the solar panels work great and only need a couple of hours of sunlight per day to keep the batteries topped off. Video quality is great and I've got eyes on the whole yard now. Just picked up 3 of these beauties. Simply system anyone can install and operate. Thank You Ring!! I bought a camera system a few years ago with a hard drive a 4 wired cameras. Wires all over the house and you need a PHD in programming to get the system to work. It ended up in the trash without ever making a single recording. Ring just makes it all doable for the average Non PHD humans...
customer_reviews.author: Daim

customer_reviews.title: New Camera, New Update!!
customer_reviews.text: Updated Review: Received a new camera from Ring. Setup this past weekend and it has been great so far. A lot different and better results from my first go with Ring. I had upgraded my network devices, modem and router. No more drops or freezing. Worked with Alexis from Ring support and she has been great!! The camera works flawless.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Tarpey

customer_reviews.title: Only sensed motion about 30% of the time. Had ...
customer_reviews.text: Update 5/21/2020 a Ring rep eventually contacted me after this review and worked with me on finding another Ring product to fit our needs. They sent us the ring doorbell. We installed it and have been using it for about 10 months now. It’s worked really well for us. So 5 stars for the customer service that made sure we had a product that worked well for us and our needs! Only sensed motion about 30% of the time. Had multiple boxes delivered one day and it didn’t pick up motion from any of the delivery people. Ridiculous. I tried readjusting the angle multiple times and finally requested to return since it wouldn’t work as needed.
customer_reviews.author: Katrina

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy. No tech support. Dies after a few months.
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after a few months. Solar no longer charges the battery. I purchased a second battery after tech support suggested it. Now devices complains of battery door open (which it is not). And the device gives bogus motion alerts every 10-15 seconds. Now as useless as the tech support I got in troubleshooting/fixing. Looking at other brands now such as Nest or Arlo. Ring had a great premise, but now the products simply don't work. Getting rid of doorbell and this camera. Aggravating.
customer_reviews.author: Damion Michaels

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Update #2 With the solar panel or the charging cable you can buy from Amazon the battery issue goes completely away. Now you're left with a great camera, I have several. Update, the battery only lasts 2 weeks. Beware, the spotlight cam wired has a 20-foot molded cable. The mount is the one that is actually wired. The camera works well, but the battery does not. when I went to order a different solution the website is very misleading. you may want to watch some customer installation videos to get an idea. Awesome camera. Bought it off the treasure truck. Hopefully they will have this again.
customer_reviews.author: Livinnsc

customer_reviews.title: No good. Choppy or black video on good wifi signal
customer_reviews.text: Really expected more from this. Yes, our Wi-Fi signal is good. The videos and live streams (when not a totally black screen) are choppy and jumpy, and just not very good. Ring Customer Service has promised me numerous call backs and have never actually followed through. Just an overall frustrating experience. Guess we will be returning this for a refund as this product just doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great product for any home!
customer_reviews.text: I definitely like this product overall as well as the ring doorbell 2 we have. However it does intermittently not work as it’s supposed to. Light won’t turn on at night when someone walks by it or when you disable the unit for a certain time you choose, the lights WILL turn on. Overall satisfied though and love this addition to our doorbell. I feel good knowing what goes on while I sleep and can check the videos in the morning.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Martinez

customer_reviews.title: do not buy this product !
customer_reviews.text: This camera only works for 30 days then Ring forces you to buy one of there plans so you can keep monitoring your home. Once your thirty days is up they block your camera from securing your home so you can't access any videos to see who is there. Ring does not disclosed this information before buying that you will have to pay after thirty days to keep watching the security of your home and accessing videos unless you pay them. Might us well have just purchased a plan with ADT security and pay them the monthly fee instead now I have A $200.00 camera that doesn't work. Good luck trying to reach somebody!
customer_reviews.author: Frank L.

customer_reviews.title: Optimizing your signal strength may take some time and patience if you have a less than ideal wifi signal strength.
customer_reviews.text: All in all a excellent product. There was definitely a learning curve in optimizing the wifi signal strength and the purchase of a second Ring Chime Pro (I already had a video Door Bell 2 and a Chime Pro.) The reason I still give a five star is I suspect the issue is more with my router/wifi hub than the Ring products. The instructions and short videos are clear and accurate. The two times I called customer service I received prompt, knowledgeable and courteous assistance as well as a no fuss quick replacement for the initial Ring 2 I purchased from a third party when the motion detection did not work.
customer_reviews.author: hiker0696

customer_reviews.title: Ring is cheaper and the hd clarity is amazing on my app.
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd product that I bought from Ring, I have the doorbell 2, and the chime. I needed a camera for my back door and this fit the bill exactly. it was so easy to install and i love the new rechargeable battery it makes everything so easier. i looked into several companies security companies for a similar product like ADT, Comcast Xfinity, ATT etc.. and they all were so overpriced and there monthly fees are outrageous when this camera price if u spread out over 12 months is way cheaper with no contracts whatsoever. very simply for a mom like me to install and watch tru my phone app. I love the Ring.
customer_reviews.author: Blanca

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent, has missed detecting visitors at front door several times
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why Ring is ranked so highly? I bought this product a month ago and it has been very inconsistent. It will pick up the motion on a car passing by on our neighborhood street (which is a good 25 feet away). However on 2-3 occasions, we had a salesman at our door stoop and NOTHING went off. The person will be only 7 or so feet from the camera and no motion is detected. So it makes me question, how many times the Ring camera did not go off?
customer_reviews.author: Gina P.

customer_reviews.title: I would caution anyone from buying this product if they ...
customer_reviews.text: I would caution anyone from buying this product if they intend to use it in an area that has any wildlife at all. Squirrels and birds set it off constantly . After 60 days of use the battery door failed to stay closed . I am beyond the 30 day warranty period so I am stuck with it . Be aware . Follow up to previous review. I am constantly having issues with the battery door erroring out and disabling the unit. I have since bought 2 nest cams that have both operated flawlessly
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Teribble App/Hardware
customer_reviews.text: Either the App or hardware is a factor here, but when i get alerts that there is motion and i attempt to view them, all i get is the spinning wheel saying "Please wait". Then, it fails to connect. Its so frustrating because someone can be at my door, and i cannot see who at the moment. Update: 11/05/2018 - Customer service is great! Someone has reached out to me to resolve my issue. Full disclosure; i returned the item since we couldnt resolve the ongoing issue. Having said that, the customer service rep stayed on top of the issue proposing ideas to help in resolving the issue.
customer_reviews.author: ChiChris

customer_reviews.title: Has some design flaws
customer_reviews.text: I have several ring cameras. The pictures are always great. They all seemed to have problems activating the camera when you go to live mode, but usually open up from a notification. The link system is awesome. This camera continues that trend. The mount on this camera is terrible. The extension that connects to the wall mount is so short you can’t tilt the camera down because the camera hits the wall. So I can’t get video or motion where I want it. Not sure why Ring did not make the extension about a 3/4” longer so you can adjust it down. I will need to buy an aftermarket bracket.
customer_reviews.author: Floridaman

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your time or money
customer_reviews.text: Returning! I’m super disappointed this didn’t work. It connects inside my house, but as soon as I step outside, the live view can’t connect. What’s the point!!!!!!! It’s for outside!!! For 200.00 I think this thing should have enough capability to connect right outside my house and it was literally 15 feet from the room where my WiFi is and it couldn’t connect.
customer_reviews.author: SA

customer_reviews.title: SOFTWARE SUCKS
customer_reviews.text: The equipment is excellent. Their software sucks. Frequently a motion alert cannot be viewed quickly on my phone (android) or my wife's phone (iOS). Our house could be ransacked before we even can watch the video! The only time I needed to see someone vandalizing our house all I could see was a infamous Ring black screen. Shameful. They need to get their sh... act together and get their software up to speed...literally. And, no, it is not our router which is high speed Xfinity. If I hadn't spent a thousand dollars on their equipment I would go with another brand.
customer_reviews.author: DrB

customer_reviews.title: Only records for 20 seconds
customer_reviews.text: Amazon, in their quest to increase the battery life of this device has decreed that it will only record for twenty seconds after motion is detected. This means that once the camera is initially activated it will only record for 20 seconds. So basically, you can see the beginning of an issue on your property, but not the middle or the end. This is a huge negative for a product like this. Based on my conversation with support, Amazon has no intentions of changing this any time soon. Other than that, it's a good camera, motion detection works well as does the night vision. Was easy to install. Only returning due to the absolute abysmal record length.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Baldwin

customer_reviews.title: Garbage app and product
customer_reviews.text: This thing is garbage. It seems to work every now and then. Some days it catches motion and the other days it doesn't. The spotlight doesn't even turn on when my doorbell picks up the motion. Most of the motion is picked up by the door bell and this camera is linked to turn on. I bought ring because of the rant and rave and I wanted a camera doorbell. I had arlo pro 2 cams before and decided to go with the ring products and the service. I am going back to arlo and never messing with ring again. I'm probably just gonna stick this in my backyard since this camera is garbage and go back with arlo.
customer_reviews.author: Trish005

customer_reviews.title: Bad one but zero regrets...
customer_reviews.text: This would have been our 4th Ring device but we sadly got a bum one...that said, these are incredible gadgets and we have zero trepidation about refunding and ordering another. Being able to watch our beloved cabin while not there has been a huge pleasure - for safety obviously but being able to watch the wildlife etc. is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Kitty Turner

customer_reviews.title: Live view feature is a joke
customer_reviews.text: Live view is a joke on all Ring cameras. We have total 4 Ring cameras, doorbell 2, spotlight, stickup. The live view feature is just not dependable. At times you need to see the live view, 90% you see the spinning "activating device..." long enough till you have no need to see the live view or it simple the app showing "cannot connect". We have mesh wifi all over around the house, so the connection is not the issue. Read some where stating ring cameras have low processing power, it cannot do two things same time. Say if it is process a motion event, then it wont show you the live view... Really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: michaelye168

customer_reviews.title: The Ring system is great.
customer_reviews.text: This was my first Ring product. After I was finally able to get it hooked up it worked great. The range for WIFI reception is very short. With this camera mounted just outside my front door it was unable to receive the WIFI signal from my whole house WIFI router. Of the many products I have that are WIFI dependent and can reach the router from far greater distances this camera is quite disappointing in its range.
customer_reviews.author: Just Rich

customer_reviews.title: Hidden subscription fee and motion sensor won’t capture what you need
customer_reviews.text: Garbage. Motion sensor aren’t even with the price paid. Returned after failing to capture obvious damage to my home. Only has kids leaving area of vandelism. I backed out before I have to pay device account to view and download is insane. The subscription fee was a surprise. There are other better quality cameras without subscription. Similar level of fake camera will deter but that’s it. And the ring neighborhood only helps burglars and vandals flag on a whim by opening account without buying ring camera.
customer_reviews.author: Indigo Tigress

customer_reviews.title: Can't control motion zone with battery version
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the battery version and solar charger. But I didn't realize with the battery version, you do not have the ability to adjust the motion zone. This can be a real problem depending on the area you're trying to monitor. I would have purchased the wired version if I had known about this prior to my purchase. I wanted to provide this review so others might make an informed decision before purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Danno

customer_reviews.title: Terrible support for issues
customer_reviews.text: There is an issue that came about end of 2019 with devices not being able to connect to ring servers and hence all your videos are a black screen. Saw all the complaints on rings community page. Ring marked the issue as solved, but no solution has been found. You will be paying ring for blank videos. I suggest you find another product, cause this device ain't worth the money. Update June 2020: Contacted Ring and they couldn't fix the issue, so are sending me a new device because it is still under warranty. Will update if I have to pay shipping and handling for a faulty device.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob C.

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat disappointed
customer_reviews.text: When I read the specifications on this camera I interpreted it as having the same abilities as my flood light camera minus the flood lights. This is incorrect. The sensing range is much shorter and the night vision range is barely 10’. Had I known this I would have opted for something else entirely. I got this camera as a perimeter camera so I wouldn’t need to supply it with 120v. While the battery life appears to be good, and the camera’s ability to maintain a WiFi connection is phenomenal, the camera’s sensing range AND poor night vision are huge hindrances. Would be fine for a stoop camera or something similar, but the doorbell versions do that just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Deeply disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Bought the Ring cam given the popularity and reviews. Easy install but deeply disappointed with the performance. Motion sensors were fine but the night vision and spotlight feature make this camera practically useless and dated. I mean you can hardly make anything out at night unless it's literally 5 feet away from the camera. As of today, there are many other options for an outdoor security cam with excellent features. I really wanted something to work seamlessly with our Alexa-enabled home. Guess, I'll have to wait. Dear Amazon, anyone listening? Anyone?
customer_reviews.author: madrobot

customer_reviews.title: Only records 20 seconds...
customer_reviews.text: Only records for 20 seconds after it detects motion.... So I'm supposed to hope someone in my property is quick about whatever mischief they are up to? This makes this product useless to me. And you want me to pay 100 bucks a year for this? Good for live monitoring.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian S. Jones

customer_reviews.title: I gave this product on honest Test and was hoping for the Best, but it won't work as
customer_reviews.text: The Ring Spotlight Cam Battery Security Camera APP is awful... It may connect video feed 45 percent of the time.. Motion detection works 35 percent ... and if it detects motion the spotlight turns off before threat is gone... or an average of 2 minutes.. I gave this product on honest Test and was hoping for the Best, but it won't work as advertised
customer_reviews.author: Robert Comer

customer_reviews.title: Good camera for a battery operated watchman.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good camera, but you need to understand that the battery model does not work as well as the wired model. The wired model is sometimes a little glitchy too. This camera died in about 24 hours. Ring customer service was great and got me a replacement in 1 week. I paired it with the solar panel and at the end of every day the battery is at 100%. I reccomend.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Matten

customer_reviews.title: Hard to install and blocks signal
customer_reviews.text: I was excited about getting this and then my excitement turned to frustration. First getting the case on is almost impossible without ripping it. Then once on my camera would not connect to my app. Removed the case, connected. Tried this twice to ensure it was not my imagination. Back it goes. Trying another brand to see if I have better success.
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy any products from Ring!
customer_reviews.text: Beware of ring fraud! Do not purchase any of Rings products. Ring stuck it up my six for $400.00! DO NOT BUY RING PRODUCTS!!!!! You can stick my refund wherever. $400.00 is not important to me, but beware that I have written reviews on my PBA, FOP and Vets combats and otherwise. I am in touch with every law enforcement in every state. I have also sent these posts and emails to include Amazon which my family so far has stent thousands of dollar at Walmart which would have been spent at Amazon, You will soon hear from the FCC when my attorney's will contact them. I have poster this on my PBA, FOP and Veterans web sites
customer_reviews.author: Edwin Leister

customer_reviews.title: Spotlight Gotcha
customer_reviews.text: The camera works great. For clarity - it is ONLY compatible with 2.4ghz band. I would argue that the wifi signal strength far surpasses that of the Ring doorbell, oddly. The resolution is great and the motion sensor is accurate. The spotlight is pretty bright but the SOS alarm remains untested. Also lesser advertised, the boxiness of the camera is because, although it comes with only one battery, it has room for two batteries!! However, this review is for the camera only...the battery SUCKS. We loaded it with two batteries and with minimal use, they last about 6 weeks. Not bad I guess but I would expect a bit more when compared to the competition.
customer_reviews.author: Team Brule

customer_reviews.title: Straigntforward setup and installation
customer_reviews.text: It has built in charging monitoring. I put a second battery in to make sure several overcast days in a row don't completely discharge the batteries, and hooked a Ring XL Solar Array to it. The ring settings page lets you see the batteries' charge status. At first, one battery was charging, and the other was draining. When the draining battery hit 11%, the Ring started using the charging battery for power. When the charging battery hit 90%, it cut over to charging the 11% full battery. Very slick. I'm waiting to see how much a battery drains overnight, but I'm sure it won't take long for the solar array to recharge it.
customer_reviews.author: Crash and Burn

customer_reviews.title: Two Years of Frustration and Poor Performance
customer_reviews.text: I bought three Ring cameras and the doorbell. Expensive investment for poor reliability. - It is incredibly slow, buggy, and crashes frequently. - I have NEVER been able to use the "Two-Way-Walk" feature on any of the cameras. - "Live View" feature takes at least 30 seconds to connect. - Video recordings are choppy and freeze after about 8 seconds into the loop. - Customer service calls always end with same result....it's my fault (poor wifi, mounting distance, etc) There's got to be something better out there and I'm looking.
customer_reviews.author: Edward

customer_reviews.title: Nice....when it works
customer_reviews.text: Has very week wifi range. I hassled around with a range extender and it would work sometime and often I had to press the reset button which was a drag as it was 15 feet off the ground. I remounted it to 7 feet off the ground as to get to the reset button better but now the darn thing does not work and I am disappointed. Although, the solar panel recharger works great. I am going to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Ike A. Lindo

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY THIS JUNK
customer_reviews.text: POOR HARDWARE. SOFTWARE APP STOPS WORKING AFTER RETURN DATE EXPIRES BY AMAZON, SO NOW I HAVE TO PAY A MONTHLY SUBSCRIPTION IF I WANT THIS JUNK TO WORK. BATTERRIES DRAIN TOO FAST. LAG IN VIDEO RESPONSE. CAN'T ADJUST MOTION RANGE PROPERLY. SAVE YOURSELF THE HEARTACHE. THIS SHOULD BE A GOOD PRODUCT, BUT ITS NOT !!!
customer_reviews.author: CHARLES R WALLACE II

customer_reviews.title: No wonder they’re on Sale! They DON’T work!
customer_reviews.text: The lights never turn on even if you and several other people jump up and down directly in front of it! Please, please spend your money on a different brand. This is the SECOND ONE I’m sending back. Would be nice if the lights worked. Update 09-01-2020: sending everything within the 30 day return window will allow. All my Ring units locked me out today with a "406 Not Acceptable" error. Defect or not, it's not at my end. Some support forum posts suggest that means that your IP has been banned or blocked by ring. No help from call center on that, so time to switch to Eufy.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny P

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy the battery version. Get the WIRED Spotlight or Floodlight.
customer_reviews.text: Over priced product. The battery powered spotlight camera is a lower quality product when compared to the WIRED Spotlight and Floodlight. Picture quality is not as sharp, night vision has a lower range, and you cannot create custom motion detection zones. You can tell the camera was designed to maximize battery life at the expense of camera features. ***Update 4/16/20*** After less than a year since I bought it, the camera is now defective. The camera has stopped working and no longer records videos.
customer_reviews.author: sonetype

customer_reviews.title: Spotlight doesn’t always stay on long enough
customer_reviews.text: I love my Ring Spotlight Cam. It works great for the most part. Sometimes at night, the spotlight only turns on for 30 seconds and is off long before we even get out of our vehicles and doesn’t turn back on. Usually it’s just me or my husband, but what if it was an intruder and we weren’t near our phones to live view? Then other times, it’ll stay on the entire time. Also, our battery died less than a month. Mostly because we have an annoying squirrel that sets it off 10-20 times a day. Still a bummer tho. Otherwise, I love it and the app works very smoothly. I’ll be investing in the solar panel soon!
customer_reviews.author: Savanah

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent..Maybe try one that continuously records
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this product, but unfortunate it doesn’t work consistently. Pros: Picture is clear (most of the time). Installation is super quick and simple. Cons: It does not always pick up movements. There’s no record of what is at the door when Ring doesn’t initiate. This has happened multiple times and is my biggest pet peeve. Also live view in the app doesn’t always work. For instance someone recently rang my doorbell, no notification for ring and the live video wouldn’t load. Quit disappointed in this product. It doesn’t continuously record so it’s pointless if it’s not detecting the motion.
customer_reviews.author: Natasha

customer_reviews.title: Much better units on market with no subscriptions!
customer_reviews.text: Total piece of garbage. The battery cover didn’t fit right. I assume mine was defective, the screen was black and white, and would only go to color if I turned on the led light from the phone app. Even then the picture was poor. Also before I put it up I put a fully charged battery in inandvset it in my living room. I walked by to see how sensitive it was. The motion eye never picked me up. Then after about keeping it sitting out for an hr my battery was at 93%.
customer_reviews.author: christine cisle

customer_reviews.title: Works great but may have issues in colder weather
customer_reviews.text: Worked great until it got cold. Once it dropped below 20F, battery went from 75% to dead within hours. How can you have an outdoor battery powered camera that cant handle cold temperatures? Ring's recommendation is to bring it inside to warm up and charge. So basically this camera is useless in the winter. Update: Ring customer service reached out and replaced camera with a plug in version which has worked without issue in single digit temps. So A+ for customer service. But still, if you live in a colder climate I'd recommend getting a plug in version or at least a solar panel to keep batteries at max charge.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Very Poor Distance
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this hoping to provide security and be able to cover my small yard and driveway. Unfortunately, the motion sensor only reaches out about 6' to 8' away from the camera and would only activate if someone was at the bottom step of my porch. I called Ring support to see if there was a way to extend the motion sensor range and was not provided any resolution or reason as to why it's such a short distance. The only solution was to point the camera higher to cover the yard ... but then it wouldn't cover my deck and door (sigh).
customer_reviews.author: D. Pugh

customer_reviews.title: Great battery operated camera but could be improved.
customer_reviews.text: Great battery operated camera. I didn't have an electrical outlet in the area where I needed the camera, so a battery operated camera was my only option. I wanted the Ring floodlight but they don't make a battery operated one so I bought the spotlight. The light on the spotlight is not bright enough for what I needed so I bought a solar powered floodlight from another company to light up my driveway. The camera works great. The "night vision" is poor quality but with my extra flood lighting the quality of the picture is fine. The notifications can be a little slow and sometimes it is slow showing the recording but overall I am satisfied with the camera.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Warren

customer_reviews.title: Great Effective  Products
customer_reviews.text: This camera works well and is effective. One thing you really need is that solar panel for that ring camera is awesome the battery level is always 100% ! Worth every penny don’t have to deal with charging the battery ever other week. Both camera and solar panel are real easy to install. First program and link it prior to the install.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for outdoor use.  Love my integrated Ring System.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for outdoor use. Love my integrated Ring System. I was using ADT and paying $60 per month. I decided after doing some research to convert everything to Ring. I purchased many Ring devices and they all work seamlessly together. You can do anything you needed ADT for using these devices. I am not putting ADT down, just saying why to pay $720 per year in a 2-year contract when I purchased my entire Ring system for less than $1000 and got more devices and features.
customer_reviews.author: Dave K

customer_reviews.title: Novel concept, bad customer service and product reliability.
customer_reviews.text: Very displeased with RING and the 1 year warranty. Started getting Camera Door is open messages, then the lens images started getting blurry. Had this happen on one other camera a year ago. Tries to contact RING (Phone and IM is the only method available, just an FYI) IM message stated my camera is out of warranty, but they could fix at my own out of pocket expense. 1 month out of warranty. With my experiences of the phone app, and the limited warranty I will not be recommending this system to anyone. N
customer_reviews.author: Capt618

customer_reviews.title: High price product that doesn’t work as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Live view works rarely. Most if the time I cannot see live view, so what’s the use of all the technology and I feel I just threw my money to the garbage. Very expensive and a fraud, I want my money back but the return window is closed (bad luck), I was giving the cameras and ring Doorbell a chance and trying to find out how to make the live view work. Another bad experience is that when they sell it, the company never mentions that you will need to pay a monthly fee to be able to record and look at past views, this is deceiving. In all, I do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: J.Q.

customer_reviews.title: 4K should come next
customer_reviews.text: I have 6 ring cameras. I feel if your Wifi sucks your cameras are gonna suck. With that in mind you will need a WiFi extension like google WiFi or another brand. Don’t buy the ring one cause it’s too weak. After I got a WiFi mesh cameras worked very well. But my other thing is. It eats batterty so get the solar power. Now after you spent $1000-1500 you might as well buy a poe system. No battery issues, no solar , no WiFi problems, faster response times. Set and forget. My take after owning it for 1.5 years. Also get a 4K system
customer_reviews.author: MrParis

customer_reviews.title: Slow and not reliable
customer_reviews.text: Although the camera works okay most of the time, I can't give it more than one star because a security device needs to be reliable all the time, and this one is not. There's often latency of 5-10 seconds before the app displays the image, and sometimes the app doesn't connect to the camera at all. If you're trusting your safety to this device -- e.g., detecting an intruder before he breaks into your house rather than after -- the camera and app simply aren't reliable enough to do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product, spend the extra Money on Better quality
customer_reviews.text: This ring product is terrible, it doesn't turn on when motion is detected if it does it only turns on when the detection is at the end. Additionally the support that is provided by RIng is terrible. The Wifi stopped connecting and the support told me to buy a new Ring Device...
customer_reviews.author: Logan

customer_reviews.title: Cam Battery Spotlight!
customer_reviews.text: Camera is really easy to set up and mount. Resolution is good,I use it for Kid monitoring and Gate security in the backyard. Notifications are good,I get shadow movement alerts here and there. My only gripe,is the toggle for the light. (It does not have one). You must open live view to turn the light on and off,I would much rather prefer to have an actual toggle like the Ring floodlight. I understand it's battery powered,but it has an option for 2 batteries. Dunno,just a little frustrating. Overall I am Happy with all 3 items:(Spotlight Cam,Floodlight Cam & Doorbell).
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Potts

customer_reviews.title: The product doesn't work. I spent 1 hour on ...
customer_reviews.text: The product doesn't work. I spent 1 hour on the phone with support and they could not get the camera to update. $200 an the camera does not work. Cant return it because I have had it for 31 days and the return expired yesterday. Wow! Very unhappy with Amazon and Ring!
customer_reviews.author: V Moore

customer_reviews.title: As advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Ring honestly makes the best security cameras hands down! I purchased another one yesterday in addition to this one because of the durability, range and quality of the camera. Might be a small camera, but clear and great motion range of viewing. The best way to make sure that you get a great wireless signal is by also getting a wireless router that covers the square footage of your entire home. I’ve got a Netgear Nighthawk, which works excellent in terms of wireless range and managing plenty of bandwidth to constantly stream all my ring cameras.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: When a electrical connection is not available...
customer_reviews.text: I have a ring system hard wired throughout my entire home, and am also using their professional monitoring. I am satisfied with the camera quality, reliability of the system, and all features. I purchased this ring spotlight cam because I decided after doing all my wiring that I wanted another device, and it would have been cost prohibitive to attempt to draw electric power to the location for the light/camera. The battery has a long life, and the device has ability to use two batteries, so when one is depleted, it transfers to the full battery. Good products, and response customer service at their 800 number.
customer_reviews.author: M. S. Horowitz

customer_reviews.title: Clear picture, convenient
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this camera for a couple weeks and it performs well so far. Very clear picture and help to monitor my house when I'm not around with live view and motion captures. The only draw back is that you can not set motion area that you want to monitor. I live on a busy street, so there are motions all the time, this makes the battery drains faster. The solution I found is to buy a solar panel along with it, so the camera will be charged without you having to take the battery off for recharge. Overall, it's a good camera so far.
customer_reviews.author: Nina

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic outdoor camera
customer_reviews.text: 17 months after buying this product it stopped working. I tried using Ring Support online and kept getting redirected to community support forums, I wrote a review and was contacted by ring support shortly after. They replaced my defective device and ensure that I was completely satisfied. Their support may be difficult to reach but once you do they are incredibly helpful. The battery life on these cameras is excellent as well as the quality of the images! Fantastic outdoor camera!
customer_reviews.author: B. C.

customer_reviews.title: Ring and Amazon have created a shady little company that sells your info
customer_reviews.text: Love the product hate the company's ethics, lackluster security (doesn't even need 2 factor identification, doesnt warn me of strange IP address login attempts) as well as some shady dealings (embedding 3rd party tracking software in the app and releasing personal info to these 3rd parties, sharing videos with police or other entities without notifying me) these breaches of confidence are enough to make me opt out of this company. I'm not the product so when you start getting shady I'm done. I have a few different camera systems and now I will be dumping Ring for another of these. Probably YI
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Beans J

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I have the basic protections plan ($3/mo) and the camera, that is set up correctly, only records motion every 5-15 minutes at random. I have a lot of activity near my front door, so if a car whizzes by at 11:02a and someone steals a package off my porch at 11:05a, the Ring doesn't record the package being stolen. It has missed the mail carrier EVERY SINGLE time. It has missed packages being delivered. It has missed people coming to my door and knocking. I cancelled my subscription and will be returning the spotlight cam and the solar panel. Two stars because when it does record it's very good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: I’m not sure if it’s the motion detection or what but, by the time it actually starts recording the car or person is already gone so it’ll record nothing. I’ve had to expand the motion section by a lot in hopes of it actually recording whatever went by. That had caused the battery to drain. It’ll last maybe 30 days: The WiFi signal always goes out but we might need a new router. Night vision is great!!
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: Does not work/ tech support inadequate
customer_reviews.text: After being gifted a Ring Doorbell, I decided to add a back porch camera. Easy install and everything worked for about a month. Then nothing but trouble and frustration. Have to continually pull it down from mount, remove the device from system, reboot and add device back to system repeatedly...like once a week. The tech support is inadequate and frankly, I question the software programming in the camera. The camera also can not be turned off from giving you alerts even when you have turned alerts “off” in the app. So when the camera is working and we are on the back porch, you get alerts every time someone moves from their chair! Not good at all!
customer_reviews.author: Trey  Burnett

customer_reviews.title: Save your money.
customer_reviews.text: It works good but the video quality ok. Definately doesnt look like 1080p but more like 720p. The sound quality isn't great either and It ocasionally fails to detect movement from our mail carrier and even the amazon person, yet it detects a cat and falling leaves, go figure. Overall, it's an ok piece of equipment because it does what it's supposed to do but the quality isn't the greatest, hence the 3 stars. I definatelly wouldn't reccomend spending $200 on this unit. Instead, consider getting the newer Ring stick up cam.
customer_reviews.author: Pskizzle

customer_reviews.title: The product will not perform as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: The product will not operate at max settings. I was told this by Jose, the Ring service rep I spoke with. He lowered my setting to get it to work. The first rep I talked to told I had not done what I was asked. He essentially called me a liar, and couldn’t keep track of what product I had.
customer_reviews.author: justin martin

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Should have read the reviews prior to purchasing. We have a Ring doorbell and it works great so we stuck with Ring products. This camera would have worked perfectly for us as it was an area we do not have access to electricity but gets plenty of sunlight. We purchased the optional solar panel to go with it. What should have been an easy 10-15 minute set up turned into 2 days and hours of frustration. No matter what we did this camera would not pick up any motion - walked in front of it, waved our hands and nothing. We spent a good amount of time trying to troubleshoot with Ring's support and finally gave up and returned it.
customer_reviews.author: PA

customer_reviews.title: Not really good
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work, ordered 3 cameras, had consistent problem with one camera. Some times it works very well and picks up people walking on the street but doesn't pickup any motion if they walk towards the camera. I changed motion settings and frequency to max but it didn't help. Blink seems more reliable than this, even though the alerts are late it would definitely pick up motion and you can have motion zones too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't always detect motion
customer_reviews.text: The spotlight cam doesn't always detect movement. I have it on the most sensitive setting, where it detects any minor movement at a wider distance, yet there are times when I arrive home and it doesn't detect me, at all. I can even be right in front of the camera waving and it won't detect me. That doesn't make me feel safer in the case where somebody tries to break into my house.
customer_reviews.author: mercedes

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but you can’t recover deleted events
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had my cam outdoors with battery pack for about a year. It gets a clear picture. You get 30 days of recorded motion events. Then you pay for a yearly subscription of about $100. I also got solar panels, which work well to power up some areas but not others. The corded cam always has a picture, but I don’t have mine outside. The electricians didn’t want them outside. These indoor cameras can fall apart on the bottom pedestal. They still work but are shorter with not as great a vision area. The camera pictures are clear. But once you delete an event, you can’t recover it. If anyone else deletes it, you can’t get it back.
customer_reviews.author: kristine

customer_reviews.title: Pros and cons but cons won
customer_reviews.text: This camera has pros and cons. Pros-super clear and crisp picture. When the live works, it's in pretty much real time. Cons- the live never works! My camera was set up 15 feet away from my wifi box and it still wouldn't connect. Dropped the signal, reset itself, wouldn't show a live view. Its a beautiful camera but I ended up returning it. I got a different brand and it works perfectly with the wifi.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Battery runs out too quickly.
customer_reviews.text: It was a disaster placing this camera up top on my house side. I was advised from ring sales that the battery would last long and it did not last but three days. At time of purchase they did not have the extra battery in stock so I had them put camera up with just one battery and what a disappointment. Battery ran out so fast . Not able to get up on a ladder and change it so camera is dead tell maintenance can come I do not recommend spotlight cam battery. 👎🏻
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Impressive cameras but buy the warranty and extra batteries.
customer_reviews.text: Great device with lots of really cool features. Blows through the batteries faster than expected. Have to recharge both every two weeks. Recommend a wired version if you can. Takeaway.... don't mount these where you can't easily access the batteries twice a month! One unit did break down within a month. Customer service ran me through the diagnostics and then replaced the unit with a refurbished one. Course, they sent the wrong replacement unit so I had to go through the process again. They got it right after a few weeks and all is good for now. The takeaway.... buy the warranty if your time is valuable.
customer_reviews.author: Lewis Chamberlain

customer_reviews.title: Camera Quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my uncle’s home, he was looking for a camera for a very long time, but the camera quality was never up to his standards. This camera is perfect, it’s the perfect size and from our front porch you can see all of the front yard and beyond. It’s the perfect size, the only issues we have is that we have to keep interchanging the battery’s too often, but we found that they do sell the batteries for 30$ here on amazon. All in all I would highly recommend 👍👍
customer_reviews.author: Therese-Claire

customer_reviews.title: Battery lifetime
customer_reviews.text: This is pretty good for a family home, nothing fancy. For safety reasons, like creepy neighbors. Very effective. I wish it had better battery longevity. I had ordered 2 pack of cameras; each camera came with one set of batteries. It actually has slots for two batteries for long lasting life. That was a disappointment. I guess buy another 2 sets of batteries. Other than that. It works pretty well. Our wifi is not the quickest but, we get the motion a few seconds later. No big whoop. As long as we can prove creepers are creeping. Know what I mean?!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Many Good Features
customer_reviews.text: This camera has excellent video quality. I have it connected to a solar panel which keeps the battery fully charged so I never have to change batteries like on my Blink (of which is constantly). The wifi is finicky, I had to buy an extender and place very near to the camera. My camera is is mounted near one of my Blink cameras, it seems to not pickup some of the nuisance triggers like bugs flying by.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Above average security camera.
customer_reviews.text: If you position your router in the prime location you will be able to access your videos, if not, you will end up with dead spots in recordings. I have my spotlight cam battery centered on my garage to view my 2 car driveway and it is able to view both vehicles and the street for people walking by. Unfortunately 90% of my motion is not people even with person detection turned on. I recommend linking them to your other ring cameras to capture all angles simultaneously otherwise you may experience a delay in recordings. I also have the small solar panel and works great, 2 batteries installed and kept full in the SoCal weather.
customer_reviews.author: S Fam

customer_reviews.title: Great Outdoor camera, needs an antenna
customer_reviews.text: Works great at detecting motion. Good fisheye and distance in light, less distance about 50-70 feet at night. Love that I can turn on light and talk through camera. (Make sure you do 2-factor security) Got 30 day free trial. I have outdoor with a non-Ring solar panel, using one battery. Never runs out. I had to get a range extender because my router is central in the house. even with a range extender it is skipping at times. I wish this model had an antenna built in or at least when connected to the solar panel used the connection as an antenna.
customer_reviews.author: cwglindn

customer_reviews.title: Bad decision
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera to secure my property. Well at first it seemed to work but then it only catches the before and not the after. When checking this security spotlight camera out I stood right in front of the camera itself and it did not detect me. When placing a call in to see what's was wrong the customer service person didn't seem to care except that I was told that all Ring camera/doorbells and what not needs to all be within 30 feet of the router or it will not work. So I just ended up sending in all my Ring equipment. What a waste of time and money. :(
customer_reviews.author: garry barbich

customer_reviews.title: Pretty simple, convenient, and cool surveillance camera!
customer_reviews.text: We just recently got and installed our ring cameras at home, and so far, they are good. Here are the pros and cons that I’ve noticed: Pros: -it’s very easy to install, compact, and nicely built -you can access it from your phone, and the two-way talk and siren alarm are some of the best features Cons: -You need to have a very strong wifi connection to make this thing works, otherwise, you’ll be needing a signal booster -It’s a bit expensive for that price
customer_reviews.author: Mikaela SJTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Get a solar panel
customer_reviews.text: Update: After about 6 months one of the cameras has died and Ring support only allows you to ask other users for help on their forum. Severely disappointed in the lack of customer service here. This is the second of 3 ring devices that has failed on me. Changing my rating to 1 star for customer service. The product is a 3 star when it’s functioning. You’re going to want a solar panel. If you live somewhere snowy you’re going to want a second battery and a solar panel. The quality is decent. It’s generally grainy and I’ve found improving WiFi signal doesn’t really improve it much. I’m much happier with my Wyze cams.
customer_reviews.author: KX

customer_reviews.title: Not Great
customer_reviews.text: This camera picks up motions of cars driving by all day but both the camera and Ring doorbell didn't pick up footage of an Amazon delivery person placing a package at my front door. Waste of money. Update - I've been on Amazon Chat for over 2 hours. They have transferred me to 10 people (Retail, Product, Echo, Audible and Ring Team). No one can answer my question as to why it's not picking up all footage so they keep transferring me. So product isn't great AND customer support is worse.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ring cameras are the absolute best!
customer_reviews.text: Great color picture. Responsive to motion. App integration is excellent. Once I saw how good the recordings were, I signed up for the year program. Worth it. Love the integration with Alexa. "Motion detected at the gate," she says. The programming choices are excellent, so I can set it up so it only alarms me at night. But all motion is still recorded. So I can look at the history when I am gone and see who came by. Without reservation, highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Ring product and I am very satisfied with it. Even though we have a very small backyard, my fiance wanted to install a spotlight cam (bc let's face it, you can't be too careful) It was very easy to install and set up. The picture is SUPER clear and it allows me to see everything I need to see. I love how it has lights and an alarm. I haven't had it long so I am curious on how long the batter will last, however, I do like the fact you can insert two batteries (one for backup) Additional batteries are only $30 on Amazon so I purchased the 2nd one (as I think everyone should)
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa Farrar

customer_reviews.title: Product ok but not great
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed with this product. The camera stopped working in November after being installed five months. I have tried six times to contact Ring. The only way is through chat which no one is ever available. I included my email for a response when a representative became available. I never received an email response. The lag time with the cameras and doorbell are terrible. I have a great wifi signal with everything in my home except the ring products. They always show weak signal. Switching to a different company. Makes me sad since i have already spent around $500 on ring products. Update: ring replaced my camera. New camera working well.
customer_reviews.author: Donna B

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: So I have had this for about a week and it is not only useful but fun. It was easy to in stall. Easy to set up. Ready to use in a minute or two. I was so impressed and happy I am putting the battery spotlight cameras in. I would suggest that you get something that you want that is inexpensive then join the protection plan and buy the expensive stuff using the 10% off you get. Pays for the plan.
customer_reviews.author: Clyde Layton

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent
customer_reviews.text: Will not consistently work ! Picks up motion 1 out of 20 . Half the time it won’t let me live view
customer_reviews.author: Darrin Wicker

customer_reviews.title: Good image, bad audio.
customer_reviews.text: Image is good and can be seen easily. The adjustments for the different motion zones is easy as well, the app is easy to navigate through. The big draw back is the very bad audio quality. It is basically non-existent, even when having both the phone and the camera with strong wifi signals there isn't much more than crackling in the audio, and that is the case with both cameras that I received (and I tested them in different locations that all had a strong wifi signal). It's too bad and I only bought another camera because the important part is the image and video quality.
customer_reviews.author: rapunzel

customer_reviews.title: You can’t go Wrong with Ring.
customer_reviews.text: I’m a ring junkie. I love all their products. But when you have a dysfunctional “neighbor” you “NEED” Ring to stop them. So far it’s working. It’s sad the world we live in that we have to put up cameras everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Grayfox

customer_reviews.title: Almost useless, keeps going to sleep
customer_reviews.text: Compared to the companies wired monitor, this thing is junk for its intended purpose. It lacks the functionality of the wired monitor in so many ways. It feels like this is at least one generation out of date. The unit keeps going to sleep when checked, despite its having a fully charged battery. Way too expensive for the compromised functionality. The main potential use would be as a temporary and moveable monitoring point for small and short term monitoring needs.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen F. Abbot

customer_reviews.title: Useless, siren is NOT automatic.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically for the siren so I can scare off all the unwanted traffic through my property. There is no automatic siren enabling. There is human detection, thats great. But I want when the humans pass through, for my siren to go off. I cant unless I do it manually. The person can be gone by the time I pick up my phone and bypass the unlock code, making the siren USELESS! Its basically just a cam And a Spotlight you can get way cheaper elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Iris84

customer_reviews.title: very limited tilt up/down/sideways.
customer_reviews.text: Camera quality is average, but the main problem for me is the VERY limited ability to tilt the camera up or down or sideways. A poorly designed bracket forces you to point the camera in a fixed position instead of being able to adjust to desired angle. Also it takes a few seconds to connect since it's on a battery pack and it only connects when you tell it to. by the time you get the motion warning and connect the object that caused the warning has usually already moved to another spot.
customer_reviews.author: Arman Davtyan

customer_reviews.title: Paid for new, received used!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what's going on with Amazon, but this needs to be corrected as soon as possible. When I pay for a new item, I expect to receive a new item. Not a used item. Not a returned item. The product I received had obviously been opened. The security seals on the package were broken and there were finger prints on the camera lenses! The shipping package seals were intact and the box was undamaged. This was obviously used or returned and sold as new. That's not expectable Especially for something in this price range.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Peace of Mind
customer_reviews.text: These are great for peace of mind. I did have to get a stronger wifi connection, but it makes sense, as we placed one camera as far from the router as possible. I love that I can pull up the camera on my app. The sound is great. I love the two-way talk option. Our front camera battery does need charging every 5-7 days, but I have it to the max sensitivity, and we're across from a decently busy street end. The backyard camera has been about 2 weeks between charging. You do need a special drill to install on brick, but it's an easy setup.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle K

customer_reviews.title: Needs continuous power supply.  Poor device
customer_reviews.text: It's a shame because Ring has such wide acceptance and I really wanted these Ring Spotlight cameras to work; however, they drain the battery so much that you must have an very good alternate supply of energy to keep the camera batteries charged. The solar panels barely work as well. I just think Ring never really was truthful about the longevity of the batteries on these devices. Its simply put: Horrible! I suggest you buy from another manufacturer and not a Ring Spotlight camera
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Love My Ring Camera and Amazon Echo Dot
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the battery powered RING Spot Light Camera for a little over a week now. So far it has proven to be a good product and worth the money. Installation and setup was a breeze! I have experienced a few issues with the motion sensor and WIFI signal, but I would still recommend this camera. As far as the motion sensor detection goes, it has been going off when there is clearly no motion detected, and other times it has not quickly detected motion. As for the Echo Dot that came with the camera, it is amazing! Love it and set up was super simple.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Smithey

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: WORTH. THE. INVESTMENT. Works like a charm, easy to set up, highly recommend you pair it with the ring spotlight cam solar panel, then you never have to worry about the stupid rechargable battery, ever. Thing has worked through rain or shine. Great HD quality video and sound. I do wish you could get more granular with some settings, like for example the sound, we get dozens of false alerts a day because of cars driving by or birds chirping nearby or the neighbor moving patio furniture across the yard. Otherwise this is an awesome product. Will buy another for my back yard.
customer_reviews.author: tommy_gunnn

customer_reviews.title: Ring expectations
customer_reviews.text: Some detections are too sensitive ie when cars pass by but when actual people are walking around or coming into my property, the detections are not picked up on. Some defections are useless. When it should be detected it isn’t so that is worrisome. So my expectations were high and have not been met. It is still a good product. Use of solar panel is the best. I am yet to connect it to Alexa.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia M. Claustro

customer_reviews.title: The camera only record 30 sec !!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: the point of having a camera is to know what happens when you are not there, and if the camera only records 30 sec, I can only know there was a person in front of my door for 30 seconds and I have no idea what he did after the recording time. a thief only needs to cover his face for 30 seconds and do whatever he wants to do after that. and you have no idea of what happens even if you had a 100 dollar camera. and you paid a monthly fee for it !!!! what's the point??!! this feature is not good at all. and the product is not useful.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Ring Battery Cam review
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera. Picture is clear. Night vision is great. Motion detection gets 4/5 stars because you cannot block off certain areas in the camera’s field of vision. As in...my camera covers my driveway, so it can look over my vehicles and property, but I can’t narrow the field of view to not see every car that goes by on my street. I have a couple Blink cameras and they CAN do this...so I know it is well within reach to have them be able to do that. Besides that one issue, the cameras work flawlessly. (I have two) In the picture, the red is the area I want to be able to turn motion detection off of.
customer_reviews.author: S. Brassard

customer_reviews.title: Works well when it works
customer_reviews.text: I really like the spotlight feature and since adding the solar panels it really completes the system. The major drawback is the terrible Live view, it doesn't work about 75% of the time, you will have to use the Rapid Ring app for that which is about 90% reliable. Don't plan to try to speak with anyone on it immediately because of the lag or can't connect problems. My wifi signal is very strong with a MESH system and 1 gbps down, one of their CS people tried to help and she was quite nice, but it seems it's more of a hardware issue.
customer_reviews.author: RWM

customer_reviews.title: Battery lid
customer_reviews.text: The lid from the battery compartment is super fragile and sensitive, it won't stay in place. If this is the way it's designed, a bird or a squirrel could easily open it exposing the battery to weather conditions. I think this is a defective unit but I'm not bothering with it. I think I'll try simply safe instead.
customer_reviews.author: Allie

product_meta.title: Ring Spotlight Cam Battery HD Security Camera with Built Two-Way Talk and a Siren Alarm, White, Works with Alexa
feature_bullets: Connect your Ring camera with Alexa then enable announcements to be alerted when motion is detected. Talk to visitors through compatible Echo devices by saying “Alexa, talk to the front door”.
Lets you see, hear and speak to visitors from your phone, tablet and PC
Powered by the quick-release rechargeable battery pack.
With a Ring Protect Plan (subscription sold separately), record all your videos, review what you missed for up to 60 days, and share videos and photos.
Monitors your home in 1080HD video with infrared night vision and Live View
Includes built-in LED light strips and a siren
Includes Lifetime Theft Protection: If your Camera gets stolen, we’ll replace it for free
